Skill.label: Main Ice Shot Setup(GMP for leveling if needed)

PathOfBuilding.Notes:
3.9 Changes:
NOTE: Ice Shot has proven to be quite expensive to gear up early this league and has suffered from the loss of Voidfletcher. It is much better suited as a second character once you've made some money. I am recommending starting with Molten Strike Slayer, Storm Burst Trickster or Lacerate Gladiator. If you do start Ice Shot run a secondary 4-6 link setup specifically for single target, Barrage, Scourge Arrow and Artillery Ballista are solid choices. I've been seeing a lot of success running Ballistas. They draw attention away from you and deal solid damage.
NOTE: Using GMP during the leveling process is totally fine. New things like Arrow Nova Support, Great Volley and Awakened GMP/Awakened Arrow Nova are worth trying as well. The Awakened GMP may even prove powerful enough to leave in the build permanently. In which case you could chose to run a more powerful bow!
NOTE: With the arrival of 3.9 the defensive capabilities of virtually all monsters have been increased. This is especially apparent against rares, uniques and bosses. The game as a whole has become more difficult.
- Added a new leveling gear section and a new leveling tree! The item set can be changed using a drop down menu right above weapon 1. The leveling tree can be changed using a drop down menu just to the right of the Patreon button when viewing the tree!
- Frost Bomb has been added to our CWDT support at a low level. This will automatically lower our enemies resistance and life regen occasionally during fights.
- In the endgame we Ideally we want to be running any added projectiles from our ascendancy, weapon (Arborix/Death's Opus), possibly a quiver with new influence types and of course Dying Sun though that may prove impossible for a while. This is done in order to cram as much damage into the build as possible.
- Use any relevant Awakened Support gems you can get your hands on!
- The new influence types introduced in 3.9 can yield +1 projectile rare quivers! Be on the lookout for those as the economy stabilizes.
- Due to the Mirage Archer nerf I currently have it dropped from the build. I swapped it out for Cold Penetration support as monster resistances have been increased. Mirage Archer is undoubtedly still solid so feel free to mix it back in if you'd like.
- Ice Shot was actually buffed! - No longer leaves Chilled Ground on impact. - Now deals 130% of base damage at gem level 1 (from 120%), up to 174% at gem level 20 (from 147%). - Now Chills enemies as though dealing 100% more Damage at gem level 1, up to 195% at gem level 20.
- Hyrri's Ire was nerfed but is still quite strong. - Hyrri's Ire now has 100-145 minimum added cold damage to bow attacks (from 173-188) and 160-200 maximum added cold damage to bow attacks (from 240-262)
- The Arborix Assassin Bow was added as a fantastic alternative to Death's Opus. Many additional alternatives for both Endgame and Leveling gear were added as well.
- Several unique items were dropped due to potential scarcity and price. This includes Lioneye's Fall, Voidfletcher, Windshriek and Watcher's Eye. The build is now substantially easier to gear. - Dying Sun is being left in for now as it is still extremely helpful for the build. If it is not affordable for you swap it out for one of the alternatives. The build will be just fine! - Lioneye's Fall was removed as it only provided slight benefit to the build and made it much tougher to gear. - Losing Voidfletcher a solid hit to our single target damage but doesn't affect our clear speed in any meaningful capacity. If Voidfletcher proves to be attainable in 3.9 be sure to pick one up! - Pandemonious is not currently being used but is recommended for those shooting for pure offense.
- The skill tree has been slightly reworked in multiple areas to accommodate for the Lioneye's change. The resulting DPS is almost identical and we gain a meaningful chunk of life! - Notably Point Blank has been dropped due to its recent nerf. It is too much of a liability to our long range DPS for me to recommend.
3.8 Changes:
- I Added Vaal Pact, as it increased our life leech capabilities drastically with relatively little downside!
- Pandemonius actually chills enemies near you when YOU are hit. Which will still happen fairly frequently against bosses but not nearly as often as if we were creating that effect ourselves.
- The original barrage setup I recommended in the video should not have included hypothermia, this has been corrected in the PoB.
